review: Heâ€™s a good doctor and very knowledgeable and cares about his patients

He is thorough and knowledgeable as he should be, he is a doctor. He does not communicate and his office hours are very inconvenient. I feel I was discriminated against as without notice the day before an appointment I got a call from his office stating he would no longer be my primary care physician for a reason I was never made aware of until refusal to treat. I feel there are circumstances that have nothing to do with me as a patient that relate to his refusal to treat me. The reason I was given could have been taken care with a phone call from his office. How was I able to make an appointment if I was no longer his patient? Why was I not notified prior to my appointment that this decision had been made?
Go to him as he his is a doctor, but just know he seems to forget he deals with humans, and in a random moment of need when you are in physical pain due to an accident unrelated to anything else he could say you are no longer his patient.

I have been very pleased with Dr. Grivej. He is thorough, knowledgeable, patient, kind, and if I have questions, he goes out of his way to give me helpful answers. He suggests solutions that I haven't thought of, and he is NOT anxious to prescribe medication. He encourages me to avoid meds if not necessary. I am so glad that I found this physician. I am very satisfied with his care. He does encourage bloodwork to be done to be sure that everything is all right, and when it is, he is obviously pleased.
Excellant physician. Spends time explaining all ailments that a person has reported.

I have been a patient of Dr. Grivej since 2003. I was referred to him as I was new to the area. Dr. Grivej is an excellent, caring doctor. The fact that he remembers things about me between visits still amazes me. The fact that he has the same staff as he did in 2003 I believe says a lot about him as an employer, as well as a person and doctor. He has never ran any unnecessary tests to make money as another has suggested. As a matter of fact, he doesn't like to do x-rays unless medically necessary so we are not exposed to the radiation. I have had doctors in the past that will do that just for the cash. When I was having financial difficulties, he wrote off my family's debt. He takes the time necessary with his patients and does not turn you away if you walk in without an appointment. He sees everyone, even if they have to stay late. He's not a God, but he is a very good doctor and a good person. I recently moved about half an hour away, yet will keep Dr. Grivej as my doctor.

He is just amazing. Needs to have all the other Doctors follow in his footstep. I just adore him to death and will be deeply sadden when he retires...Gotta love him. And to all you negative people, get a life and find some other doctor who will put up with your ****ing. Move on!
Voted among top 3 doctors in Oakland county by the newspaper readers in 2009 best of the best! Agree!

I went to see this doctor after my mother in law recommended him - she is elderly and she adores him, although even she will admit that he misdiagnosed her that she almost died. I had a different problem with him: I asked him to write a script to get the tests done at a different lab that is closer to home, but he wanted me to come and do it at his office (I got the impression he tries to maximize his office visits). So after I asked for a script to be called into a lab near me that my insurance covers - he literally screamed at me on the phone suggesting that I am questioning him and threatening that unless I do tests in his office, my insurance won't cover it. I never saw him again. I was very upset the way I was treated.

Dr. Grivej is the physician who gives of his time to visit and treat the elderly patients and residents in Lourdes Assisted Living facility. Watching him listen patiently and compassionatly while my 82 year old mother rambled and slowly complained while trying to explain her "situation" he gets all my admiration. He deeply cares about the elderly and his concern is genuine. A wonderful gerintologist!
speechless, just speechless, his work is out of this world
Very knowledgable and extremely respectful doctor.

I've been a patient of Dr. Hamed for about a year now, I can honestly say that by far he is the best doctor I've seen in many many years. He has helped me to quit smoking, I've been smoke-free for 5 months now thanks to all the help of Dr. Hamed. He would even personally call me to check on my well being. I recommended all my friends and family members to see him. God bless this sweet, honest, caring and good looking young man.

Dr. Hamed is an awesome doctor. He puts his patients needs first. Dr. Hamed really cares about each and every patient. He would always personally call and check up on me, that made me really highly of him. I highly recommend him to anyone who is lookin to pick a great doctor.
Very thorough, caring, knowledgeable. Good bedside manner.
Wonderful MD. Always have same day appointments. The Doctor takes his time and answers all your questions
THE BEST DOCTOR, EVER! Listens,empathetic,great sense of humor. Been my dr.for over 20years.Man would give you the tie off of his shirt to help you. =}

The office staff is VERY friendly and helpful. The Doctor is very knowledgeable and took the time to explain things to me in terms I could understand. He has been my Doctor for many years and the staff he has now (Kara, Shayla and Mary)are the most caring and helpful I have ever seen. They truly care about their patients and it shows in every way. I highly recommend this office and Doctor to all my friends.
I will make him my permanent family doctor. He helped me with problems that I have ahd for years with my old doctor. I highly recommend him.
Dr. Gilreath has been my families doctor for years, he is awesome!!! He has taken care of four generations of my family and we all love him. I totally trust him and highly recommend him!

I have been a patient of Dr Gilreath for a year or so. I have never seen a more thorough Dr. I feel like he really cares. Never rushes,listens, and makes sure you have had all your questions answered. Wonderful Dr

Dr Gilreath is educated, provides exceptional care and is highly recommended for patients looking for a primary care physician. I have been his patient for more than a decade and he never disappoints.

He has taken care of four generations of our family. More than once he has caught medical conditions, specialists have missed. We trust him completley and love him completly. This is the best doctor you will ever find to treat you and your family!

Since I'm new to the Health Insurance world, I had to pick someone who accepts my insurance. I picked Dr. Sheehan because she is minutes from my house & she was a female doctor which I am more comfortable with. I LOVE her. She is caring, concerned and takes a lot of time talking with you about what is going on and working with you. I never feel rushed. She always listens carefully and is so compassionate. I would recommend her t anyone.

She was wonderful. Very efficient and through. She was extremely personable and I liked her and her qualified staff immediately. Very professional but down to earth and spent a large amount of time going over with me the proper procedures for different ways of handling my medications. I felt I was in very good hands and I look forward to returning for my follow up visit. Unlike most doctor's offices, I didn't have to call back for my test results, they must work pretty quickly because I got a call from them about 3 days later telling me my test results and it was very reassuring that she and her staff take the guess work out of medicine. She was amazing and I loved her personality!

Dr. Sheehan is a great doctor! I never feel like I am being rushed through an exam so she can get to the next patient. She takes the time to truly listen to me and is very caring and compassionate. Before Dr. Sheehan I never had such a complete examination -and she explains everything that she is doing. She is very knowledgeable and down to earth. I've recommended Dr. Sheehan not only to other members of my family (who now go to her) but to friends as well (who also go to her). She gets a five star rating from me! *****

Dr Sheehan is the absolute most caring doctor I have ever seen. She takes the time to make sure you understand everything about your illness and will not make you feel dumb about anything you need to ask. I will recommend her to anyone looking for a new doctor.

Above all Dr. Sheehan is caring. She spends lots of time getting history and facts surrounding an illness. Then she spends time with the patient other doctors often do not. I highly recommend her. She has treated our sons and my wife as well as me for over five year. We appreciate her!

I came in with a bad cold. I waited an hour and a half to see the doctor. Her assistant told me that she is a thorough doctor and as the day goes on patients have to wait a while to see her. She prescribed me antibiotics and sent me on my way. After finishing the dose for ten days my sinus infection had not gotten any better. I called the call center on Tuesday 2/7/17 in the morning to see if she could give me a different prescription or if she needed to see me again for an appointment. On Wednesday 2/8/17 I had yet to hear from the doctor so I called again. The call center was confused as to why the doctor had not reached out to me yet and that they would put a second notification for her to call me. The call center also stated that they couldn't offer me an appointment either because she was booked up. I ended up seeing a different doctor who was able to prescribe me a stronger antibiotic. I am now feeling 100% better. Today, someone from her office decided to return my call to check on my symptoms. A week after my second phone call to their office. Some thorough doctor she is. I am in the medical field and understand how schedules can change with emergencies and add ins but that is rediculous! Clearly, she only values her own time.

I was nervous about picking a new primary care physician especially not knowing Dr. Smereck. On the first visit I was wonderful surprised. She treated me with so very well. She listened to my health concerns and her experience, sincerity & concern were obvious. I felt that she listened intently & constructed a plan of action immediately. Very thankful I found Dr. Smereck.

Dr. Smereck is awesome. I have never written a review on anything before, but felt compelled to so after my visit with her today. This is a Doctor who truly cares about her patients, she never once made me feel like I needed to rush and is extremely compassionate and understanding. Honestly if more Doctors had her bedside manner patients would have a better experience. I would highly reccommend her to anyone who needs a Doctor that actually does care and we all know those are few and far between!

Being a helathcare professional myself, I am picky about the care I receive. Dr Smereck is extremely knowledgeable and competent, as well as personable. The office staff members were also incredibly personable and helpful. I was in and out for a new patient visit in less than an hour and had all of my concerns addressed. I will be recommending Dr. Smereck to anyone in need of a primary doctor!
Most compassionate and caring doctor I have ever encountered.

Dr. Smereck is a wonderful physician. She is warm and compassionate, and she always has time for you. I never feel rushed when I'm in her office, and she always, always takes the time to make sure that everything I came to see her about is addressed. Very knowledgeable, yet able to communicate effectively on "layman's" terms. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a primary care physician!
Outstanding, compassionate. Best doctor I have ever encountered

I needed a new primary care doctor so I went to see Dr. Smereck to see if she would help me. I have a chronic condition so I felt it would be helpful to advise her what was going on. She was extremely hostile, demanding to know why I was there before she hardly even introduced herself. She basically said she couldn't help me before I could even get my story out about needing a new primary care doctor. She made me feel so uncomfortable and unwanted. There was no loving caring demeanor here. She was rude and hostile. I have never been treated like this by a doctor before.

Dr. Smereck is a most wonderful doctor who combines great medical knowledge with a loving, caring demeanor. I'm a 70-year-old Hepatitis C patient and feel my health needs are being totally met. The most wonderful part of being Dr. Smereck's patient is her loving care. Also, she allows me to have an active voice in my treatment. We work as a team. I trust her completely to make the right choices for me but she also listens to my input. I respect her and at the same time...I love her as a friend. She's very down to earth, never arrogant or egotistical as many doctors are. Everyone who knows her loves her.
Dr.wijekoon cares about his pateint alot . highly recommended to be as a family doctor ,excellent thoughtful,caring doctor.
#NAME?
He is good doctor. Listen to concerns but Don't have much knowledge. Calls multiple times.. even if issue could be resolved in single visit.

I went to see him one time at the walk in clinic and immediately asked if he could be my family doctor he is extremely thorough and he truly does care about all his patients if you live in MIssissiauga he is the doctor I personally would recommend .

He is the one - I would recommend if you are in Mississauga area and looking for new family Docter. Amazing, Very Throw with his knowledge and take enough time to listen to you and understand your Problem - Highly recommended as he keeps patients in the center of the care and directs the different healthcare professional. Multidisciplinary approch.
Very pleasant and knowledgeable doctor. Unlike many other doctors, he is personable and is genuinely interested in his patients' concerns.

Always late on appointments.Minimum 1Hr late if not busy,2hrs if busy.Dr.Wij talks too much,with so much delays.Surrounded with fake ,rude,and unhelpful staff(depends if your nationality or race is same with the staff)
Always makes you wait very long. I waited 3 hours last time. Doesn't really give you a definite answer and makes you WAIT again for refills

Kindly update his address:
Mississauga Health Centre
3420 Hurontario Street
Mississauga ON L5B 4A9
Phone: 9052720165
He makes you wait an hour for scheduled appointments. and he is unwilling to followup with paperwork.
Excellent doctor! Couldn't have gone through my surgery without his help
We love Dr.Chaney and thank God for her, Dr. Chaney is an anger sent by God. She has been our Dr. for 35 years.
Love doctor Chaney..... She have been my doctor since I was a child!
Dr Chaney is the best doctor I have. She geninely cares for all her patients. I only wish she had another office that took appts so that you did not have to wait all day.
Great listener and thorough. I recommend her. Strong knowledge base.
She was thorough and a good listener. I highly recommend her.
She was a good listener and addressed the problems I came in with. Very thorough. I highly recommend her.
I've seen this doctor a couple times. She spent quite a bit of time with me at each visit and made me feel comfortable.

She is rude, condescending, and treats her patients like morons. She has no compassion for sick people, if people at all actually. I've never had my health issues disregarded so quickly. While practically in tears in her office she just stares with a belittling smirk on her face that plainly says she can't wait until you leave. She left the room for a moment and I could hear her laughing and talking with the nurses and then came back eating a granola bar or something. Clearly helping me wasn't a priority. I will make sure no one I care about has to deal with that heartless woman.

i had never met this lady she was filling in for my doctor that went into labor a couple days earlier first thimg was i heard her outside my room talking about my medical history infront of strangers si right there she broke the hippa law then she came in with a horrible bed side manner i have never felt so belittled in my life i was there for a check up and she did not write me for any meds but yold me i had to take a drug test i will be looking for a new doctors office and clling to report her

My doctor is Dr Jackson But she had gone into labour the day of my appointment So I had to see this other doctor She was one of the rudest people I have ever met she Ask me why I was there And I explained to her that Dr Jackson had made me the appointment to check on the new meds I was on she didn't care she rushed me out of the room without asking about the new medication she constantly cut me off when I tried to speak then I was left in the hallway wondering which way to go or if my appointment was done I had to hold back the tears when I left the office and I let the nurse is know I would not be returning until Dr Jackson came back the worst part is before the doctor came in the room the nurses warned me about her I would not recommend her to my worst enemy never have I ever been treated so rudely disrespected I am going to file a formal complaint against her do not go see her go see someone else

She treated my teenagers like adults asked good question/gave good answers advice and information so they learn how to be responsible in their heath treatment. Explained their treatments to them not at them or only to me. The wait to be seen at times is a little long but to have teenage boys respect and like their dr. especially a female dr. is worth waiting for good care.

This doctor made me bleed during a routine pelvic exam, refused to test my thyroid even though I asked her to, and was generally careless during each appointment. She did things like jam the instrument painfully into my infected and swollen ear, and over-prescribed unnecessary medications in order to get the appointment over with.

I was extremely unfortunate to have Dr. Puno as my care provider in my younger years. I came to her with a skin issue (years later confirmed as simple psoriasis by another doctor), which she diagnosed incorrectly. Her directions as to how to treat the skin issue involved the use of alcohol scrubs and treatments to rid the infection. This of course seriously dried out the psoriasis ridden skin, causing immense pain, peeling and cracking and more than likely was a large reason why the area in a short period of time developed MRSA. YES, MRSA. Not once, not twice but THREE times in the course of a couple of months. She continued to treat it incorrectly again, and again and again until I was hospitalized and put on IV antibiotics that caused my spleen to swell while I was on them. I was told just not to take any hits to my torso because it might cause it to rupture. Eventually, I just stopped going to see her all together, because dealing with the skin issue sans MRSA seemed better than her treatments that obviously were not working. Flash forward to a couple of years later when I confront a new doctor about the skin issue. It took her maybe 2 seconds of looking at the area to know what this very common skin condition was. She gave me an ointment, and voila! It began clearing up the next day. My grand parents had numerous health issues in their old age, which of course is to be expected. Puno was their primary care doctor, and both have since passed. As I said, they certainly were nearing the end of their lives, but I shudder to think if she could miss such a simple thing and put me through so much turmoil, what could she have been missing with them?

I think Dr. Puno is great! She has been my family doctor for about 7 years now. I trust her with my daughter, and she has overseen my daughter's health since childhood and now in to her teen years. If she is not as knowledgeable about a particular condition she has never hesitated to refer us to a specialist. When my daughter and wife both had their respective health issues, Dr. Puno referred us to excellent specialist. One doctor was so go I credit him, and Dr. Puno, for saving my wife's life. I will keep her as my family doctor for years to come.She is usually pretty good on getting us in on an emergency/urgent basis too.
Dr. Puno listens very well and I think that she is an outstanding physician! Her staff is excellent also!

I've gone to Dr Puno for about 3 years. I loved her at first but lately I've started thinking about changing doctors. First off they are always running behind, my standard wait time has turned into an hour or more each visit. The staff seems stressed and not very friendly. They never say hello or greet you at your appointments. Dr. Puno used to take the time to listen and really get your background, now too she seems stressed and in a hurry. Instead of finding a solution she is always prescribing medicine to mask the symptoms. I'm just starting to get very frustrated.
a very understanding person.has been very helpful to me.knowalgeble.smart caring.i would highly recomond her to any one.her staff is awsome.always willing to your condsinders.

This doctor is friendly and sweet BUT not very knowledgeable or confident. It might be due to the foreign accent that she does not seem to be articulate or thorough in explanation. This is a critical must in having good communication with patients. She mumbles and her voice trails off- again, not a sign that gives me much confidence that she knows what she's talking about. I just really did not feel that she was competent.

Very interested in all patients. I have recommended many patients to her and they have all done the same. She gives you a hug when you need it. She goes all thru your case every time and asks about how everything is. Very helpful on prescription coverage. Has saved me many dollars with generic drugs and does follow up on how the drugs are working. She will personally call to find out how you are.
I wouldn't trade or change my doctor for the world he's genuinely concern & very through, I would recommend him to anyone that need a good dr.

I have been going to Dr.Harris for about10yrs, always willing to go the extra mile for me and I really love his staff. I don't think there was a time I called to get in on the day of and them not get me in.the ladies always do my paperwork without compliant I am not sure who I like better the ladies or the Dr.

I've seen Dr. Harris as my GP for over 30 years. He's always knowledgeable and willing to listen to my health concerns. My waiting room time for my appointment for a routine physical today was minimal, five minutes or less....
they are very great they do excellent work there skills are simply outstanding

I have been a patient of Dr. Harris for 15 -plus years. He has always been professional and given me very good care. What I find most important is that Dr. Harris will go a step further and make a referral to a specialist anytime my health made one mandatory. He can be rather aloof, but always professional. I saw him yesterday and he seemed jollier than usual; possibly because I chose to follow him to his Sterling Heights office when the one in Detroit was closed. He gave me a very effusive greeting and smiled during my entire office visit.

Dr. Harris is distant and not willing to listen to patients concerns. I mentioned to him that I was concerned about some cardiac symptoms and he abruptly dismissed my concerns. His staff is unprofessional and argue among themselves within patients earshot.

i found dr harris to be a very strange man. he was argumentative and i fely he didnt want to helpo me...my first clue was when he asked me to get off the examining table so he could put his laptop there...he made me very uncomfortable and after one visit i never went bak. my opinion is hes a jerk!!

I HAVE BEEN GOING TO DR. HARRIS FOR 30+ YEARS. HE HAS ALWAYS BEEN KIND, CARING AND CONSIDERATE. HE LISTENS TO WHAT YOU HAVE TO SAY, AND TRUELY CARES ABOUT HIS PATIENTS. I HAVE NOT HAD INS. FOR 8 YEARS, AND HE HAS ALWAY DONE HIS BEST TO GET ME SAMPLES OR LOW COST Rx'S. STAFF, THEY ARE GOOD TO ME, AND A GREAT SUPPORT OF DR. H. OVERALL, I RECOMMEND HIM TO OTHERS. I DON'T CARE WHAT DR. YOU GO TO, YOUR GOING TO HAVE TO WAIT, SO DON'T BASE YOUR DECISIONS ON JUST THAT ALONE.
Poor attitude, very distant, nurses are very rude. Talks more to his computer than to his patients.

Candy Doctor at best. Her office had no privacy, she does not practice HIPPA laws. Her employees are not certified and they write her scrips. People don't even come into her office because they know if they call with a sob story shell just give them whatever. The doctor writes scripes in covered patients names knowing there for someone else. This office is a joke and is under investigation from the DEA for her over abundance of scrips for narcotics.

I have been seeing Dr. Ahmad for several years and I would not change physicians. She is extremely caring, takes as much time in the room as you need (despite running behind). She always remembers whats going on in your life and makes the visit about "me". She is very hands-on with her patients. I would highly recommend her.

Engaged in a lawsuit against this doctor -- lost, but that's Oakland County for you. All I wanted was an apology that was sincere and not prompted for ignoring my drug side-effects that ended up causing permanent damage. Crazy. Don't be scared to second-guess her judgment! I'd hate for anyone else to get hurt!

Been seeing her for nearly 8 yrs, basically becuz I could call in symptoms and get a script. But that doesn't happen anymore! She's compassionate, caring, friendly, family oriented and nice, but I sometimes questioned her. Everytime we had to see her (for whatever) we had to go get XRays (became a joke at home). One time, I was desperate and took my baby to her (pediatritian not avail), she did a urine test and told me my daughter had alot of blood in urine. *Cups were kept upside down in bathroom for anyone to touch and not sanitizing wipes for clean catch* Went to pediatritian first thing in AM and there was no blood. Poor call. She has one GREAT Nurse, but the rest of them are Extremely unprofessional, dress and talk the same way. One time actually came into my room to pull her out for a phone call of a patient who just wanted to know what time her appt was(I could hear). I was hot!!! Overall, I'd see her if I had to, but I think I'll be seeking a new doctor soon.
I love Dr. Ahmad. She is very caring and remembers me without consulting my chart. Also, she is the only doctor who can help me when my allergies flare up to the point of sickness.

I have seen her for 6 years. She helped me prove that I had a neck problem when two other doctors and many other doc's said I had a heart problem. She takes the time to help your get the righr results. BCBS ok an MRI and she was right and the other doctors were very wrong but they still wanted there $ 6,000.00 dollars for not. Didn't even get sorry for all the wasted time and pain. I wish her well as a family doctor and hope to continue to see her for many years to come!

She is one of the best doctors around. I have no insurance and I am a diabetic when other doctors wanted $200 - $400 to see them she had me come in and now I am back on track. I am moving in the spring and will continue to go and see her although I will be living 130 miles from her.

Dr. Ahmad is a very caring doctor. She never gives up on finding the correct dx even when other doctors dont know whats wrong. She never makes you feel like you are just a number in her appointment book she genuily cares about each and every one of her patients.
Love her! She is the sweetest person who really listens and offers healthy (natural) suggestions to treatment when asked. She's not intimidating, like other doctors. She greets you with a smile.

This review is based on care I received from Susan about seven years ago. She is knowlegable and kind. She once drove me home after an appointment because I was 15 and pregnant and had no transportation.Hows that for being a caring doctor. I also enjoyed her staff greatly (shout out to Sonya). Only thing I did not care for was the hour-half to two hour wait from each appointment in the small waiting room. I do believe that is the only reason I had to stop going there. I just couldnt take a day off work each time one of us had an appointment.
She is a very thourough and excellent Dr. She is very caring and honest.

Dr. Rice is has been our family doctor for over 20 + years. Appointment times are sometimes delayed based on the seriousness of the perceived illness. Always spends the time to due a good examination and if needed will set up a appointment with a specialist or for a second opinion.
She spent no time with my son breezed in and out of the room and had a terrible bedside manner I would not recommend this doctor to anyone

Dr. Rice is a wonderful, caring woman and doctor. What has been said about appointments meaning nothing is basically true--however, it's because the doctors in this practice spend as much time as is necessary with each patient, rather than rushing them through like other doctors I've seen. Dr. Rice thoroughly listens, follows up, and sends you for a second opinion when she feels it's needed. She is the most thoroughly un-arrogant doctor I've ever seen. She knows a lot, but she is not afraid to acknowledge her limits. I'd much rather have a doctor like this than one who pretends he knows all the answers when he doesn't.

My brothers and I grew up with this doctor and love her. To this day we still go see her even though its a bit of a drive. And I was happy to have her deliver and now care for my daughters health. Only complaint is how hard it is to get an appointment with her. And dont think about walk-ins you will be waiting for several hours in a cramped over packed office. I really wish theyd move to a larger building to handel their high volume.
VERY HOSPITABLE. ALWAYS LISTENS TO ME NEVER INTERRUPTS ME. DOESN'T TREAT ME LIKE THE OVERREACTIVE PERSON I KNOW I AM. I JUST LOVE HER.
Has two office partners, equally unknowledgable. Appointments mean nothing, may wait several hours to be seen. Missing or removed medical records and exrays from chart after several years of visits.
He is good doctor. He sees all my family , I know him for more than five years.

He is a good Doctor, knowledgeable, has good bed side manner, listen to your complaint, always answer my calls, respect the patients and very honest.
I highly recommend him for my friends and relatives.
really shows he cares. answers all my questions. would recommend
the world need more doctor's like him. he's very sincere about the care of his patients.

Dr. Zielonka is an excellent physician who shows genuine concern for her patients. I really appreciate the way she takes time to listen, and then educate clients concerning their illness. I always feel like I'm involved in my care plan. She has also provided care for two of my grown children, and they have been satisfied with the care they have recieved.
She was great, very helpful and direct. She is the kind of doctor that you run into very rarely in this life. She is as smart and effective as she is kind.
Dr. Fregoli is a Godsend. He is the most caring & knowledgeable doctor I have ever met. His staff is also very kind.
Outstanding doctor!
Been my Doctor for more than 20 yrs and the best part is having someone being personable with you and actually cares about you as a human being and not just a patient.

He is a wonderful Doctor that earns all of the respect he receives. He is totally devoted to his patients and helps in every way that he can. I've been to many Doctors and had many surgeries, and have never found anyone remotely close to this Doctor. I only wish that I would have found him 30 years ago. Two thumbs up!!!!!!!
This doctor takes the time to actually talk with you about your family and your life. He makes you feel comfortable and will treat you like a friend instead of just another patient.

Doctor Gold has been my doctor for about 15 years and I have found him to be very caring and knowledgeable. He is very persistent in diagnosing your problem and isn't reluctant to order additional testing or send you to a specialist if needed. He will call you to follow up on your condition and to let you know about abnormal test results. He treats you like family and I wouldn't think of going to anyone else!
I was his patient for years but now I have my doubts about his medical knowledge I think I am going to find a new doctor to go to hopefully I can get much better care
Not a very good doctor. DId not help my family. Will never go back.
Dr. Gold is my doctor for about 10 years. I think he is superb. He cares about patiens, he is knowlagable and his stuff is absolutly great

Dr. Gold was my doctor for many years--from the early 70s through the early 90s when I moved away. I found him to be a wonderful, caring physician. He correctly diagnosed a problem that I had had for several years prior to seeing him. He kept in touch with me to make sure I was taking care of myself. I miss him! (Nancy Smith)

The Waterford Medical Group is dedicated to their patients. The repoire is almost family like. The staff is genuinely concerned and compassionate. Dr. Gold especially, is a dedicated physician to his patients. I truly miss the folks there and I hope to make a visit when I come back to visit family. Keep up the outstanding work.
Dr White has been very willing to listen first then help look for options if answer isn't immediately known.
takes time with you and listens..very hard to find in a doctor

Good listener and does not make you feel rushed. Always upbeat, and friendly. Instills confidence with thorough questions and quick diagnosis. It can be hard to get an appointment due to his popularity.
I've been seeing him for more than 20 years and depend on him for myself and the rest of my family. He's thorough, polite, kind and always has time when I need it.

Very cordial, friendly and professional. Provides empathy without being patronizing. Able to diagnose quickly yet thoroughly. Liked enough by so many that it can be hard to get an appointment with him (think 2 or 3 months out). Recommended.

The doctor is fine. I'd put her up with any GP I've had. However, I called in prescription refills to their call-line. 4 times I've called this, each time provided all the info they needed and they never called in the script and never returned calls to say why. They are EXTREMELY lucky it was for non-critical meds, or I'd be talking with an attorney right now. I wouldn't recommend this Dr to my worst enemy.
Dr. Ferguson is excellent with her patients. She is very down to earth and makes going to the Dr. pleasant. Her staff is also excellent.. Very prompt,personal and not rushed atmosphere A+ in my book.
a very plesant doctor. seems very knowledgable. able to break things down to your understanding. the best!
He is the most thorough doctor you will find. He is a master diagnostician. A brilliant man and wonderful person.

Absolutely awful doctor. He is actually a threat to someone's health. Just because someone acts arrogant and as if they know everything, does not mean they do. He's friendly but that is of no value to YOUR health or pocketbook. He babbles without really saying anything useful or that will actively get your illness diagnosed (tests, etc). Be condescending and treat the symptoms, don't bother to find out what the h*ll the illness is. That's him! Hope it's not life-threatening. I really don't understand the positive reviews. Friendliness and confidence should never be construed as knowledgeable and competent. What's wrong with people....

If ever there was a doctor who know everything- Dr Gastman is it! He is very, very knowledgable and takes his time to explain in detail an why. Great bedside manner- I wish I would have found him years ago.
knew precisely the right diagnosis gave mr hope and a plan which proved wonderful.
This office got me in right away.Everyone was very friendly and helpful Dr. Murphy has a warm personality he make you feel comfortable.
Dr. Murphy is very helpful and has a good grasp of each patients medical needs and if is not able to help you he will surely refer you to other medical resources.

I know that people say things like this about their doctor all of the time, but Dr. Murphy is the best doctor that I have ever found. He makes a point of treating you as if you were a member of his own family. Dr. murphy saved my life. I had another physician before him and had been misdiagnosed for many years, however when I went to see Dr. Murphy he quickly corrected that and now I'm on the right track I am truly thankful for him and I let him know every time I visit his office. One of the main things I like about Dr. Melvin Murphy is if he can't seem to figure out what is wrong with you he has no problem sending you to someone who does. That means a lot to me because as I stated before I had been misdiagnosed for years because my previous physician would not refer me to another physician or run further tests, he continued to guess. However Dr. Murphy is not that type of doctor.I truly believe that he was sent to me from above. Dr. Murphy has truly saved my life. He is excellent.

Finally a doctor who listens! I have went through three with my 9 month old son. She listened to my concerns and ran tests without me needing to act! Its nice to find one who is not only caring but up to date on the current medical conditions and solutions!

Dr. Sanders is very nice but she comes into the room with a set mind of your ailment and takes no time to listen to the rest of your symptoms other than whats listed on the sheet. She diagnoised me with Strep Throat even though the rapid test came back negative and it turned out to be nothing more than a sinus infection. I ended up taking antibiotics that I didn't need to take.

I do not know this physican, the receptionist was less than pleasant, she was abrupt and said "I dont think the Dr. will return my call, they just don't do that". I was put on hold, when she returned she said "phone number" I'll pass it on. I thanked her for her kindness and helpfulness. I am not a patient at this clinic, my Mom is, I only hope that she is treated better in person than I was on the phone across the country.

The office people are rude. The wait time is horrible- have never seen the doctor within one hour of my arrival time. But when I do finally see him, he is very interested in what you have to say, takes time to catch up with you, and always explains diagnosis and treatments in terms you can understand. I understand why there may be a slight wait to see him, as he spends a great deal of time with his patients, but I still cannot understand why it takes so long to be seen once you sign in.

I appreciated how kind Dr. Crafton was to me while I was his patient. He helped me in getting stable with a new condition (that the specialist wasn't getting right), and always took the time to listen. He made good suggestions, and worked with me to help me. He was never on time for my appointments, but I stayed with him in spite of this because he was good for me. The only reason I left was because of a move, in which it wasn't practical to continue to see him.
I am 84 years old and Dr. Crafton has been taking care of me for 20 years. He takes time to listen and I would recommend him to anyone looking for a good doctor who cares.

He will write rx's for anything. I had several with wrong dosages, strength, etc. Thankfully my pharmasist caught his blunders. When talking to him, his mind wanders, making you wonder if he is even listening. I have changed doctors, and they have changed most of my meds and treatments from him. He was a good doctor, but gives the impression he may be drugged or have a mental problem. I will never recommend him to anyone.
He genuinely cares about his patients and is willing to take the time to listen.
Dr. Crafton, a very talented individual who makes me better when I'm sick! He is a very good listener which is important, a caring Doctor.
Excellent doctor. Great personality. He really cared and was very thorough in his answers to my questions.
Dr. Woelke is friendly and approachable, though seems a bit rushed, his receptionist staff are not the greatest though, and have caused us multiple trips to get things straightened out.

Personable, works with the patient. My family physician for close to ten years before I moved too far away. He spent close to 45 minutes on my initial appointment between other patients to get a thorough understanding of my history.

I completely disagree about all the negative comments. My whole family go to see him and he is an amazing physician. He is very smart and have a great personality with an awesome bedside manner. Go see him before you make a judgment based on these senseless comments. His wall with over 50 thank you cards for saving my mom, son dad grandfather and so on is a proof..keep up the good work Dr Awada you are the best. I will continue to see this doctor as long as he is in practice..Jeff V.

I really dont understand why people are writing such bad ratings. I am very sure that everything that is being said is UNTRUE about Dr. Awada. He is an amazing doctor, very smart and knowledgable. Please do not listen to these awful comments because i am sure this is just being done out of hate for a person who does not deserve this kind of treatment ! DR. AWADA IS AMAZING and does not scam anyone and does not only care about money SO UNTRUE. He cares about his PATIENTS. WE LOVE YOU DOC. !
This doctor continued to prescribe narcotics to my son after I informed him by son was addict. My son is deceased because of an overdose

Will spend 3 hours or more waiting to be seen, and less than 5 minutes with doc. He will write you a script for anything without even examining. I said I had an itch, he wrote me 2 antibiotics. What itch? Where? Who cares?? He didn't. One time, he actually said I should thank him for spending so much time with my son that day (4 1/2 min). I'm worried about my son's inability to breath, he's not interested. Sends me to an endocronologist instead. He is rude, egomaniacal, over scheduled, no empathy. People are only appts. no faces, he will argue with you, lie to you, and ignore you. Stands with the door open and talks about your private health in the hall, and then walks away as you ask a question. I've moved on after 1 year of this abuse. I found a great doctor now, and I am happy and much much healthier. This doctor will kill you if you don't get away from him. He only cares about $$ and scamming and lying. He is definitely a sociopath!

Iâ€™m unsure from the suspicious negative comments listed below for certainly do not describe Dr Awada he has been my physician for 10 years and after saving my sons life from leukemia. My family is not happy with the way this doctor has treated our wife/mother/grandmother. He is 1st concerned with the almighty dollar. He thinks that he is a specialist in all areas, when he should really just stick to family medicine and continue his studies. If he (or ANY doctor) tells you that you can "stop seeing your specialist because I can do that here," do not listen to him. Unfortunately our family trusted him and she stopped seeing her blood specialist and neurologist. Could things have been different if she had stayed with them? Perhaps - but we will never know. Regardless, ANY doctor who recommends to stop seeing your specialist is money hungry and trying to get more business himself. There are other docters in the St. John network who refuse to work with this doctor. St. John is a good hospital, find a differnt doctor besides Awada.
Knowledgable, kind and attentive. He listened to each of my concerns. I would highly recommend him
This Dr. is waste of time. For every refill you have to go to the office so he can charge your insurance company to help pay for his Jaguar and lavish home.

Do not go to this doctor. All he cares about is how much money he can milk from you and the system. No regard for peoples time and wants constant office visits to approve A NON NARCOTIC prescription that he put me on and said I can stay on for life. I had 2 office visits in 7 mos and he wants MORE!!! Trust me all this guy wants is the money and don't plan on getting out within an hour he overbooks patients. DO NOT GO TO THIS DOCTOR

Have visited the office a few times. He put me on medication that was not needed and made me feel 10 times worse went back he did nothing to solve my issue. Office is small, dirty, spend more time waiting in the room then with Dr. feels like they were after the money more then helping me. The last visit set it all off. He got there and the lady said he didn't have an appt and even if he did he is a new patient so he need to be there an hour ago (no one said anything about that)!! When I called she told me they have someone training so thats prolly why and he could come back at 8am tomorrow!(will now have to miss work!) Training or not she should be able to make an appt!
Dr S. Zalla is compassionate,knowledgeable physican keeps abreast of technologies to assist in diagnostic assessment in his speciality.

seemed all the dr wanted to do was a bunch of tests that were irrelavent (and in his office) just to be able to charge the insurance company. Didn't seem very concerned with what might really be wrong with me.

Dr completely blew me off and refused to look at the problem for more than 10 seconds. I was told it was just inflamation and it would go away. I will be going somewhere else in the future.

First off -office is bordering Pontiac. Wonderful doctor. Very knowledgeable, kind, and willing to listen.

Great doctor, great staff, very helpful, great with adults and with children.
She is saving my life. I would move with her if she left the area.
Very caring and professional. Answers all my questions diligently.

Dr. Rosin is the beat Dr. I have ever seen. He has helped me so much, we've come so far together, in the battle to figure out what is wrong with me. The most caring and compassionate Dr. I have ever had the pleasure to work with
The best
Dr. Meza is a great doctor and very kind and caring.

Dr. Katychev has been my primary care doctor for 5 years. He is patient, caring and extremely knowledgeable. Never in a rush, attentive and personable. I am a hypochondriac and always worry that he will be annoyed, but he never is. You will love him.
Dr. Eadie is one of the best and most professional MD's that I have ever encountered.

Dr. Tawansy has been my physician since 1995 & I kidd you not she has never been sharper then when I first meet her. She also knows when stress takes over and recommends alternatives to prevent you from becoming ill. She is the most consistant doctor I have ever meet. She is the greatest in my book!
Dr. Norwood is an excellent physician. She takes the time to listen to her patients and allows them to have input in the care that she provides.
He's a great doctor, he's on time if he does not know something he will find it out. He will make an effort to see you no matter what.

I have been seeing Dr. Perry Olsen at Stout family medicine for several years now-for everything.He's very knowledgeable,caring,and he listens to you instead of just looking at a chart and making a diagnosis.He will help you any way he can.If he has the medicine you need he will give it to you.If you need a specialist he knows where to send you.The staff is also very sweet,caring and helpful,with the exception of Karen at the front desk.She is very rude like your interupting her,especially on the phone,almost nasty most of the time.She acts like she is the boss,but she is just the receptionist.Pay no attention to her,she does not have the final word on anything,Perry does.They do require payment of $60 unless you have insurance for the office visit up front due to people not paying them.This is very reasonable,and they can't work for free,they have expenses too.If you want a great Dr.,one who cares about you,go see Perry Olsen at Stout Family Medicine in Detroit.
very helpful,accomodating. Deals with Pain,etc
Dr. Razook always puts my mind at ease, especially when I've been on the internet doing my own research. Dr. Razook is kind and cares about your condition and then actually treats it!

I have never met an honest, sincere Dr like Hassan. he is very personal when it comes to your appointment. he is very thorough and makes sure he asks every single question that you might think off or not think off. he only schedule few people every day because he give them enough time. honestly one of the best DR's if not the best. he is sharp with his appointments, and very techy. never seen a Dr who "thinks" before giving an answer. he doesn't through things right and left, rather try to really figure out what is wrong with you. he is young, but he has a lot of knowledge and experience. so don't let the young looks fool you.

He knows his stuff. I went for a reacurring problem through Dr L and continued to have the same problem. Then I tried Egan for a change and was gladly pleased to see he help cure my reacuring ailment with a new procedure he learned. He adds a bit of younger spunk to the office also. And the diet he put me on helped me lose 30 pounds. Hes very friendly and really cares about your health. Thanks Dr. E

Without Dr.Baul I would not be alive today if it were not for this doctor. I would avoid Dr. Baul! I don't know where to begin! The unprofessional office staff. Appointment! I really do thank God for Doctor Baul. I would not advise seeing this doctor. She ran tests on me without even so much as telling me what they would be. I thought it was going to be something small, but it wasn't. Still fighting that bill.
She is rude and thinks she is better than everyone.

I have had 2 appointments with her in the last year and each appointment I left angry because of her attitude. She was rude, and condescending. She wouldn't listen when attempting to discuss symptoms of what was wrong with me. She told me I was being "Nitpicky", and that I was just going to have to accept the fact that I will struggle with (my ailment) for the rest of my life. I self prescribed a treatment based on information I found on the internet, and all of my symptoms were corrected within 2-3 months. Today I went in only to have her order a blood test recommended by my mothers hematologist due to a genetic blood mutation. She was very condescending in her questioning. She acted like it was a waste of her time. After she left the room I waited for about 20 minutes for someone to give me the blood work order. That will be my last trip to her office.

She has no bedside manner, is very rude, and thinks she knows everything without even asking. She didn't look at my file nor did she look at the x-rays I brought in. She didn't even look at my shoulder, which was the main reason I was there, to ask for help with the pain. She cut me off with all the new patient questions, like I was stupid and needed redirected or like she didn't have time to actually listen to me. She corrected me on one of my diagnoses, which was odd b/c it has been read to me like the way I said by every other doctor I've ever had. I guess she's smarter than everyone else. She didn't even do an exam, just judged me from where she sat. After she made her snap judgment, she was done and I actually had to ask her to examine me a little bit for flu-like symptoms so I could make sure I wasn't giving anything to my daughter. I haven't had a panic attack in weeks, after seeing her, I have had four so far. I hope they don't let her see kids.

She was rude and unhelpful, she did not even look at my chart or know my name or history when she walked into the room. She told me my pain was normal even though I was miserable.
